newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine end-1996 BOP surplus at $4.107 bln.
newsitem.headline: Philippine end-1996 BOP surplus at $4.107 bln.

text.p: The Philippines posted a balance of payments (BOP) surplus of $4.107 billion by the end of last year against $631 million registered in 1995, final figures released by the Central Bank on Tuesday showed.
Earlier, the Central Bank pegged the preliminary figures at $4.2 billion.

The current account deficit widened to $3.560 billion from $3.297 billion, due to the growing gap in the merchandise trade imbalance which hit $11.213 billion against $8.944 billion registered a year ago.
Medium and long-term loans increased to $2.690 billion from $1.276 billion, while net foreign investments slipped to $1.055 billion against $1.609 billion.
Short-term capital reached $512 million, a turnaround from a net outflow of $56 million a year before.
